topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1 and 1.1.1: Add (Scale-Out) and Remove (Scale-In) Nodes on KVM Hypervisors

titlealts.searchtitle: HPE Helion Openstack 1.1: Add (Scale-Out) and Remove (Scale-In) Nodes on KVM Hypervisors

p.b: This document describes the installation process for HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1 and HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1.1.

body.p: (If you already have 1.1 installed, you can update Helion OpenStack from 1.1 to 1.1.1 by following the update procedures described in HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1.1 Update Guide.)
This document describes the steps to add (Scale Out) or remove (Scale In) nodes (KVM Compute Nodes) to an already-installed overcloud on a KVM hypervisor.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: Before you begin, ensure the following:

ul.li: The seed VM, undercloud, and overcloud are installed using the HPE Helion OpenStack installer.

section.title: Add compute nodes
section.p: New compute nodes can be added to an already-installed overcloud. You can add nodes in any of the following scenarios:

li.xref: Configure compute nodes to pre-allocated empty baremetal nodes
Enroll a new baremetal and then add nodes

section.title: Configure compute nodes to pre-allocated empty baremetal nodes
section.p: You can enroll (add) nodes that that are present in baremetal.csv but have not been used, perform the following steps:

ol.li: SSH to the seed VM as root:ssh root@<IP Address>

Edit the scale counts in JSON environment variables file (kvm-custom-ips.json) that was used during the initial installation to define the appropriate scale number:"compute_scale":<number of compute nodes>,
Source the environment variables file that you updated:source tripleo/tripleo-incubator/scripts/hp_ced_load_config.sh tripleo/configs/kvm-custom-ips.json
Run the installer script:bash -x tripleo/tripleo-incubator/scripts/hp_ced_installer.sh --update-overcloud 2>&1 | tee update.log

section.title: Enroll a new baremetal node and then configure compute nodes
section.p: To add new compute nodes that were not present during the initial installation process, first enroll the baremetal node and then configure the new node.

ol.li: Log in to the seed VM:ssh root@<IP Address>

Make the respective Baremetal entry in /root/baremetal.csv.Add the node to baremetal.csv at the end.
The full syntax is documented above. Make sure it is at the end of the file as it is a new node.

Edit the scale counts in JSON environment variables file (kvm-custom-ips.json) that was used during the initial installation to define the appropriate scale number:"compute_scale":<number of compute nodes>,
Source the environment variables file that you updated:source tripleo/tripleo-incubator/scripts/hp_ced_load_config.sh tripleo/configs/kvm-custom-ips.json

Run the installer script:bash -x tripleo/tripleo-incubator/scripts/hp_ced_installer.sh --update-overcloud 2>&1 | tee update.log
This will register a new ironic node and create a new nova instance and a new heat stack.

section.title: Remove nodes

ol.li: SSH to the undercloud VM:ssh root@<IP Address>
If using trickle (default): Identify the MAC address of the node to be deleted

Identify the nova instance 'Instance UUID' associated with the ironic Node UUID and, from that, identify the heat stack associated with the nova instanceironic node-list The instance name will be similar as shown below:overcloud-ce-novacompute0-NovaCompute0-aztnviyoamsc
so the stack name will be:overcloud-ce-novacompute0
Execute the following command to delete the stack:heat stack-delete <stackname>
Wait for stack to be deleted, run the following command until it is gone:heat stack-list
SSH to Controller0 and disable the compute node:nova-manage service disable --service=nova-compute --host=<hostName of Compute Node>

Mark the node as 'deleted' in baremetal.csv. Change the 'role' from 'OvercloudCompute' to 'OvercloudCompute:deleted'. DO NOT DELETE THIS LINE, you must edit it instead. For example:78:e7:d1:22:52:9e,administrator,password,192.168.11.7,12,32768,2048,OvercloudCompute,IPMI
becomes:78:e7:d1:22:52:9e,administrator,password,192.168.11.7,12,32768,2048,OvercloudCompute:deleted,IPMI

section.p: When hp_ced_installer --update-overcloud is run again, the node will be skipped in all operations.
Note: Do not decrease the value of overcloud_computescale in the JSON environment variables file (e.g. kvm-custom-ips.json) when removing a node.
Note: If you receive warnings from Icinga after node removal, see Troubleshooting Node Removal
